intro: Litsea pierrei, commonly known as the dwarf Chinese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its foliage is evergreen, providing year-round visual interest in gardens. Litsea pierrei is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
